comments.commentBody:
Ramen is Chinese-style Japanese noodles. The word is the Japanization of the Chinese word know to New Yorkers as "lo mein." The noodles used are called "chuka soba," "Chinese soba," in Japanese, and all Japanese recognize the dish's origin to be Chinese.

That said, ramen is thoroughly Japanese today. The main topping ingredient in many versions, chashu, is named for Chinese roast pork, cha siu, but it is totally different. It's prepared from pork belly, not loin, and is boiled, not roasted. The stocks are unlike any found in China. Ramen is Chinese only like tempura is Portuguese.

The noodle dish of Nagasaki, champon, also comes from China originally, but via Korea. JJambbong is found in Korea and Koreans in Nagasaki discovered a ready market among foreigners stationed in Nagasaki to study Japan.

The noodle trade goes both ways. Japanese udon is eaten as udong in Korea. And Chinese ja jiang mein (noodles in meat sauce) is a national dish of Korea as jajangmyeon. Coming full circle, Japanese ramen is now popular in China as well as Korea.

@ MachoMenos, when I saw the length of your comment, my first thought was, "Oh, dear god.  Really?"  But thank you for laying it down.  I started the season really liking the Jets and finished the season absolutely hating them.  I'm from Pittsburgh, a huge Steelers fan, and rooted like mad for the Jets in last year's AFC championship.  The bluster and insanity just got to be too much for me, though, by early-November.  And then, there were a few too many weeks where I came to the Fifth Down, and it was definitely more of a Jets blog than an NFL blog, IMHO (the writing still pretty much rocks, though, and I don't hate a NY paper for focusing on the region's sports teams).
A match to watch for sure, their play has been top level thus far

Earlier this month, Gov. Haley Barbour of MS suspended the lengthy sentences of two sisters convicted of a felony. Part of the rationale for the sentence suspension was saving the State $200k per year in dialysis cost for one of the sisters. A condition of the suspension is that the sisters move to Florida and thus relieve MS of a significant cost. Even a tough-on-crime Governor like Barbour is sensitive to cost.

I'm ready to "take our country back..." by cleaning up that "wasteland" left by "Corporate America" in Detroit by demolishing those old factories, and, re-roofing, painting, cutting the grass for those old widows left behind...

WHERE DO I SIGN!!!

Who's with me??

Figures...

The innovation for the last 10 years...

American Idol
iPods
Google
And... Groupon??

What a "wasteland" we live in...
Economy is great, so long as Ben keeps the presses running, jeesh.
Shhh. cant say that. rememeber, the stimulus has been a total flop.

Of course the economy is recovering, but its as sustainable as the 2003-2007 recovery. We know what happened right after?

That recovery was fueled by consumers taking on debt, which was never paid back. But when the debt-binge is going on, the economy looks great.

Contrast this to today, instead of the consumer, the government is going on a debt-binge, that again will never be paid back. So again as we gorge on this debt, the economy is recovering.

But when the US government defaults (we are spending $1.60 for every dollar we take in), crash of 2008 will feel like a walk in the park.

Nothing we have done in past three years puts us on a sustainable path. 2013-2014: we will be worse off (Geithner, Bernanke, Blankfein excluded) than today.

Economic indicators point to an upswing in hiring in the private sector. I wouldn't go so far as to say that there is a cloud hanging  over his SOTU speech. I, as he probably will, use the metaphor that skies are clearing with abundant sunshine to come economically.

People can no longer spend money they don't have or earn.

If you want the economy to turn around, we can not have so much of the income going to so few at the top. The redistribution of wealth upwards that has taken place the past 30 years needs to be reversed.

All spending is deficit spending. That's the nasty truism that the Republicans eternally exploit playing the silly game that if it's military, or through tax give backs it doesn't count somehow.

The fact is that capital spending that enhances our nation's infrastructure pays back. So does maintaining that infrastructure if it is accomplished as new capital spending not expense budget tax draw down. If maintenance was calculated into bonds they would never return. So, maintenance is always made a line item. Instead, we need a new type of bond. It should be called a P&M bond, for "preservation and maintenance" and it should be directed toward national assets like the Golden Gate, or Brooklyn Bridge - or any significant capital investment that would be better served through restoration than demolition and replacement. If it's broke fix it, but don't necessarily have to replace it.

And Obama would be wise to mention this is his State of the Union address.  He should remind Americans what the economy was like when he took office.  Americans have short memories.  Obama needs to be CONCISE and CLEAR and CONFIDENT.  Obama is an amazing President, but the criticism has been that he appears weak and too willing to bow to the Republicans.  Yes, we need to work with the Republican party... but the Democrats are the better party for America... Obama needs to remind people of all that the Democrats have accomplished in two short years.

For those people complaining that convicts get "free room and board, plus medical care", I strongly recommend you cop a plea to some unsolved crime, so that you, too, can receive the wonderful reward of serving 3 to 5 ,and being ever after marked as an ex-con.  If you are not willing to accept this fantastic deal, then please stop whining.

Main street will not be "firing on many pistons" for some time to come. How can you expect that when his major asset, his home, is under water and not recovering anytime soon. No one is willing to address the real problem, the choking of our free markets, because everyone in power is being bought off. More

This seems like a well-balanced article. The picture is one of a resilient country, struggling to pull out of the damage done by poor policy decisions that have wasted hundreds of billions of tax dollars.

Obama will be spouting the tired nonsense about "competitivness" as a means to lowering unemployment. What exactly does that mean?

It means cuts in wages and benefits for working and middle class (but NEVER for the corporate and banking exeutive class) Americans coupled with degraded working conditions in order to compete with low wage foreign labor markets. In other words, more of the globalization fueled race to the bottom for working and middle class Americans and more bloated corporate profits and executive bonus's.

More Wall Street generated economic policy that puts U.S. workers last and Wall Street banksters first.

And all this with a Democratic president? How could this be? Because Obama is a fraud who, along with his fellow corporatist Democrats, has cynically exploited the reputation of the Democratic Party, a reputation built by the domestic social achievements of great Democrats like FDR, LBJ and Harry Truman, for electoral gain while using his elected office to serve the interests of Wall Street and corporate america.

His SOTU speech will be another insult to working class americans and another good bootlicking for Obama's Wall Street constituents.

California has a recidivism rate of 67%. In effect, the CDCR is a failure.
For one thing, the skills training in California prisons is less than 10%. It has been estimated that close to 80% of the prison population is illiterate. Thee is no mechanism for promoting literacy, the prison officers have lobbied against the added responsibilities, even at the low level prisons, where they are primarily bed check officers.

When a prisoner is released on parole, he/she is required to report to the parole office in the county where they were sentenced. In some cases the unemployment rate in the particular county is much higher than in other counties. However, the parolee is not allowed to leave that county without written permission, and if given, only for short periods. Even if a parolee has a skill, and could get a job in another county, he/she is not allowed to go to that county without a transfer from the parole office, and has to get approval from the county where the job is. That transfer can not be approved until the job can be verified, and living quarters are approved by that county. In effect, a parolee, can not go to another county to even apply for a job, and if allowed to, then has to wait for approval to transfer. It usually takes 45 to 60 days for that to occur, and by that time, the prospective employer has already filled the job opening.

So here we have a case where the parolee has no income, if sentenced for drug sales, can not get food stamps due to a Federal law, and is essentially confined to a county where he/she has no chance to be rehabilitated.

The CDCR budget is 8% of the state budget. It costs at least $3500 a year to keep a prisoner incarcerated. Many parolees, simply can not keep from violating parole, just because they have no way to support themselves. The conditions of parole are draconian, also. A parolee can be violated for the most simple things, such as failure to pay a traffic ticket, of if a kitchen knife is found in another room in the house where he is living. In one case, a parolee was violated when an agent found a toy hand grenade in his child's toy box. A parole agent has almost unlimited power, and a parolee will be sent back without any court hearing. In another case, a parolee received a traffic ticket in a different county, and his agent would not let him go to court to pay it. Since he had an outstanding warrant for not paying the ticket, he was sent back.

Essentially this system is the prison guards full employment act. It is also a drain on the taxpayers of California, but no one seems to be able to fix it.

From the Coming Attractions I've read regarding this speech,  it sounds like it will be a veritable  a three ring circus!    Many   non -political  guests  had been invited to fill the gallery.   Guess one needs something to distract the audience from the reality of the economy!  Will everyone be civil? Will the president take the SCOTUS to task again?   ( Will they show up this year after last year's thrashing?)   Will the Republicans and Democrats sit together?   Will any one yell out a comment?   What color tie will the president wear?

I'll believe it when President Obama announces his unqualified support of Social Security in the State of the Union address.  I'll believe it when the minimum wage is increased, so that a single person working 40hrs/wk at minimum wage has take-home pay which will pay for an apartment, clothes, food, and other necessities.
"Prosperity's just around the corner." Herbert Hoover, 1932.

This article is simple-minded. How is the 2011 "payroll tax holiday" going to "help the economy"? All it will do is de-fund Social Security of ca. $112 million in direct revenue at a time when more of the baby boomer generation turns 65, at a rate of 8,000 individuals daily, according to the AARP. As for Toll Bros. reports, they build luxury homes-- so anything they may have to say about the economy has limited relevance to the total U.S. economic forecast. How is the U.S. manufacturing sector doing in comparison to China's? THAT is the question: orders for durable goods = jobs.

CEO pay in this country and other countries as a multiple of average worker pay used to be around 30x until the 1980s.

Starting in the 1980s, only in our country did CEO pay go from 30x average worker pay to 500x average worker pay.

If you want our economy to recover, the stealing of wages by the corporate elite from average workers has to be reversed.

It's just my opinion but this recovery spin is as suspect as our employment numbers. Do I have reason to be distrustful of such? Are you? What spin can overcome the fact that balanced trade is crucial to sustain economies and there's certainly no possible denial of our trade imbalance.
We should be discussing who is responsible for ensuring balanced trade, questioning why their efforts have been so unsuccessful along with failure to police excessive risk in financials. Why do we continue to accept unsatisfactory results, is there relationship between such and large campaign contributions? Why are we again being asked to relax regulations that were enacted because of percieved necessity, especially after our bitter experience from relaxing financial regulations? Is it true that there's a sucker born every minute? Do they feel that the rate of such has escalated? Who's on first base? Are we even in the game? Am I being cynical? Am I not? Is there reason to be?
I was never much of a poker player but I enjoyed the game. With my limited knowledge if I held the cards citizens hold today I'd demand a new deal!
And so it goes...the food industry is not serious about doing the right thing!
